intro: Brachycyrtis macrantha, commonly known as the broad-leaved daisy or mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy species adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually broad and slightly hairy, while the stems are upright and branching. Brachycyrtis macrantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
